TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {53093=§ 2321 - Validation of proprietary data restrictions, 67488=DoD, GSA, and NASA are proposing to amend the Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR) to implement Executive branch policy in the President's Climate Action Plan to procure, when feasible, alternatives to high global warming potential (GWP) hydrofluorocarbons (HFCs). This will allow agencies to better meet the greenhouse gas emission reduction goals and reporting requirements of the Executive Order (E.O.) 13693 of March 25, 2015, Planning for Sustainability in the Next Decade. E.O. 13693 subsumes both E.O. 13423 of January 24, 2007, Strengthening Federal Environmental, Energy, and Transportation Management as well as E.O. 13514 of October 5, 2009, Federal Leadership in Environmental, Energy, and Economic Performance., 55121=§ 2335 - Prohibition on collection of political information, 53287=§ 2323 - Contract goal for small disadvantaged businesses and certain institutions of higher education, 54590=§ 2331 - Procurement of services: contracts for professional and technical services, 52612=§ 2316 - Disclosure of identity of contractor, 52799=§ 2318 - Advocates for competition, 52065=§ 2313 - Examination of records of contractor, 51963=§ 2312 - Remission of liquidated damages, 20520=DoD, GSA, and NASA are issuing a final rule amending the Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR) to strengthen protections against trafficking in persons in Federal contracts. These changes are intended to implement Executive Order (E.O.) 13627, entitled “Strengthening Protections Against Trafficking in Persons in Federal Contracts,” and title XVII of the National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2013., 52425=§ 2315 - Law inapplicable to the procurement of automatic data processing equipment and services for certain defense purposes, 55005=§ 2334 - Independent cost estimation and cost analysis, 52289=§ 2314 - Laws inapplicable to agencies named in section 2303 of this title, 51821=§ 2311 - Assignment and delegation of procurement functions and responsibilities, 49788=§ 2303 - Applicability of chapter, 55242=§ 2336, 49965=§ 2304 - Contracts: competition requirements, 55333=§ 2337 - Life-cycle management and product support, 50744=§ 2305 - Contracts: planning, solicitation, evaluation, and award procedures, 50988=§ 2306 - Kinds of contracts, 53673=§ 2324 - Allowable costs under defense contracts, 49239=§ 2302 - Definitions, 53783=§ 2325 - Restructuring costs, 56476=Title 48 published on 2014-10-01, 53991=§ 2327 - Contracts: consideration of national security objectives, 51623=§ 2309 - Allocation of appropriations, 52998=§ 2320 - Rights in technical data, 52719=§ 2317 - Repealed., 52895=§ 2319 - Encouragement of new competitors, 111831=DoD, GSA, and NASA are proposing to amend the Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR) to further implement the inflation adjustment of acquisition-related dollar thresholds. A statute requires an adjustment every five years of acquisition-related thresholds for inflation using the Consumer Price Index for all urban consumers, except for the Construction Wage Rate Requirements statute (Davis-Bacon Act), Service Contract Labor Standards statute, and trade agreements thresholds. DoD, GSA, and NASA are also proposing to use the same methodology to adjust nonstatutory FAR acquisition-related thresholds in 2015., 54346=§ 2330 - Procurement of contract services: management structure, 106367=DoD, GSA, and NASA are proposing to amend the Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR) to implement a section of the National Defense Authorization Act (NDAA) for Fiscal Year (FY) 2013 to include in the Federal Awardee Performance and Integrity Information System (FAPIIS), to the extent practicable, identification of any immediate owner or subsidiary, and all predecessors of an offeror that held a Federal contract or grant within the last three years. The objective is to provide a more comprehensive understanding of the performance and integrity of the corporation before awarding a Federal contract., 54266=§ 2329 - Repealed., 51427=§ 2307 - Contract financing, 51516=§ 2308 - Buy-to-budget acquisition: end items, 51722=§ 2310 - Determinations and decisions, 54832=§ 2333 - Joint policies on requirements definition, contingency program management, and contingency contracting, 49083=§ 2301 - Repealed. Pub. L. 103–355 , title I , § 1501(a), Oct. 13, 1994, 108 Stat. 3296 ], 54735=§ 2332 - Share-in-savings contracts, 53207=§ 2322 - Repealed., 9504=DoD, GSA, and NASA are issuing an interim rule amending the Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR) to implement Executive Order (E.O.) 13672, “Further Amendments to Executive Order 11478, Equal Employment Opportunity in the Federal Government, and Executive Order 11246, Equal Employment Opportunity,” and a final rule issued by the Department of Labor (DOL)., 15015=DoD, GSA, and NASA are issuing corrections to FAR Case 2013-001; Ending Trafficking in Persons (Item I), which was published in the Federal Register at 80 FR 4967, January 29, 2015., 54118=§ 2328 - Release of technical data under Freedom of Information Act: recovery of costs, 53873=§ 2326 - Undefinitized contractual actions: restrictions}

textAfterTable: DEPARTMENT OF DEFENSE, GENERAL SERVICES ADMINISTRATION, NATIONAL AERONAUTICS AND SPACE ADMINISTRATION Final rule. Effective: May 7, 2015. 48 CFR Parts 1, 22, and 52 Summary DoD, GSA, and NASA have adopted as final, without change, an interim rule amending the Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR) to implement final rules issued by the Office of Federal Contract Compliance Programs at the Department of Labor (DOL) relating to equal opportunity and affirmative action for veterans and individuals with disabilities. 2015-04-10; vol. 80 # 69 - Friday, April 10, 2015 80 FR 19504 - Federal Acquisition Regulation; Further Amendments to Equal Employment Opportunity GPO FDSys XML | Text Additional Documents type regulations.gov FR Doc. 2015-08309 RIN 9000-AN01 Item I FAC
